storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate daily schedule display for logged-in employee
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for today and previous day
Schedule portal is accessible and operational
Employee is not already logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Click on 'Daily View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to daily schedule view and displays today's date as the default selected date

steps.action: Review the displayed schedule information for today
steps.expectedResult: System displays today's schedule with correct shift details including shift start time, shift end time, location, and role assignment. Current day is highlighted

steps.action: Click on the 'Previous Day' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System displays the schedule for the previous day without errors or delays (response time under 2 seconds). Date indicator updates to show previous day's date

steps.action: Verify the previous day's schedule details
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays correct shift information for the previous day including start/end times, location, and role

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Daily schedule view remains active
Previous day's schedule is displayed
No errors are logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to other employees' schedules
preconditions: Employee is logged into the schedule portal
Employee knows or can construct the URL pattern for accessing schedules
Another employee's ID is known for testing purposes
OAuth 2.0 authentication is properly configured
Role-based access control is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to daily schedule view for own employee account
steps.expectedResult: System displays the employee's own daily schedule successfully

steps.action: Note the current URL structure in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL contains the logged-in employee's ID parameter (e.g., /api/schedules/daily?employeeId={currentEmployeeId}&date={date})

steps.action: Manually modify the URL by changing the employeeId parameter to another employee's ID and press Enter
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an authorization error message (e.g., '403 Forbidden - You are not authorized to view this schedule')

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for the other employee is visible on the page
steps.expectedResult: No schedule information is displayed, only the authorization error message is shown

steps.action: Navigate back to the daily schedule view using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System displays the logged-in employee's own schedule without errors

steps.action: Verify all schedule details are correctly displayed
steps.expectedResult: Own schedule is displayed with accurate shift times, location, and role information

postconditions: Employee can only access their own schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
Employee remains logged into the system
No data breach has occurred

testCases.title: Test responsive layout on mobile devices
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available for testing
Mobile device has internet connectivity
Mobile browser is installed and updated
Employee has shifts scheduled for today and tomorrow
Screen resolution is typical for mobile devices (e.g., 375x667 or similar)

steps.action: Open the mobile browser on the device and navigate to the schedule portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads and displays correctly on mobile screen with properly sized input fields and buttons

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and tap 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is authenticated and dashboard is displayed with mobile-optimized layout

steps.action: Tap on 'Daily View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view loads and displays today's schedule

steps.action: Review the schedule layout on the mobile screen
steps.expectedResult: Schedule layout adjusts correctly for mobile viewport with readable text size (minimum 14px), properly aligned shift details, and all information visible without horizontal scrolling. Touch targets are appropriately sized (minimum 44x44px)

steps.action: Verify all schedule details are clearly visible
steps.expectedResult: Shift start time, end time, location, and role are all displayed clearly and are easily readable on the mobile screen

steps.action: Tap on the 'Next Day' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the next day's schedule smoothly without layout issues or delays

steps.action: Tap on the 'Previous Day' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System navigates back to the previous day's schedule. Navigation controls function correctly with proper touch responsiveness

steps.action: Rotate the device to landscape orientation
steps.expectedResult: Layout adjusts appropriately to landscape mode while maintaining readability and usability

postconditions: Mobile layout remains responsive and functional
Employee remains logged in
All navigation controls are accessible and functional
No layout breaking or rendering issues occur

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

testCases.title: Validate weekly schedule display for logged-in employee
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has multiple shifts scheduled across the current week and next week
Schedule portal is accessible and operational
Current week has at least 2-3 shifts scheduled
Employee is not already logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed with available navigation options

steps.action: Click on 'Weekly View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to weekly schedule view and displays the current week as the default view with week start and end dates clearly indicated

steps.action: Review all shifts displayed for the current week
steps.expectedResult: System displays all scheduled shifts for the current week accurately. Each shift shows complete details including start time, end time, location, and role. Shifts are organized by day of the week (Monday through Sunday)

steps.action: Verify the current week is highlighted or indicated
steps.expectedResult: Current week is visually distinguished (highlighted, bordered, or marked) to indicate it is the active week being viewed

steps.action: Count the total number of shifts displayed and verify against expected schedule
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the week are displayed with no missing entries. Count matches the expected number of scheduled shifts

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Week' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: System displays shifts for the next week without errors or delays (response time under 2 seconds). Week date range updates to show next week's start and end dates

steps.action: Verify the next week's schedule details
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for next week are displayed accurately with correct start/end times, locations, and roles. Layout remains consistent with current week view

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Weekly schedule view remains active
Next week's schedule is displayed
No errors are logged in the system
Page load time was under 2 seconds

testCases.title: Verify access control for weekly schedules
preconditions: Employee is logged into the schedule portal
Employee is currently viewing weekly schedule
Another employee's ID is available for testing
OAuth 2.0 authentication is active
Role-based access control is properly configured

steps.action: Navigate to weekly schedule view for own employee account
steps.expectedResult: System displays the employee's own weekly schedule successfully with all shifts visible

steps.action: Note the current URL structure displayed in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL contains the logged-in employee's ID and week start date parameters (e.g., /api/schedules/weekly?employeeId={currentEmployeeId}&weekStart={date})

steps.action: Manually modify the URL by changing the employeeId parameter to another employee's ID and press Enter
steps.expectedResult: System immediately denies access and displays an authorization error message (e.g., '403 Forbidden - Access denied. You can only view your own schedule')

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for the other employee is visible
steps.expectedResult: No weekly schedule information for the other employee is displayed. Only the authorization error message is shown on the page

steps.action: Attempt to use browser back button to return to own schedule
steps.expectedResult: Browser navigates back to the previous valid page

steps.action: Click on 'Weekly View' from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System displays the logged-in employee's own weekly schedule without errors

steps.action: Verify all weekly schedule details are correctly displayed
steps.expectedResult: Own weekly schedule is displayed correctly with accurate shift information including times, locations, and roles for all days of the week

postconditions: Employee can only access their own weekly schedule
Security logs contain record of the unauthorized access attempt
Employee remains logged into the system
No unauthorized data was exposed
System security controls functioned as expected

Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available for testing
Mobile device has stable internet connectivity
Mobile browser is installed and up to date

steps.expectedResult: Login page loads correctly on mobile device with properly sized and accessible input fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and tap 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is authenticated successfully and dashboard is displayed with mobile-optimized layout

steps.action: Tap on 'Weekly View' option from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule view loads and displays the current week's schedule

steps.action: Review the weekly schedule layout on the mobile screen
steps.expectedResult: Layout adjusts correctly for mobile viewport with readable text (minimum 14px font size), properly formatted weekly calendar or list view, and all shift information visible without requiring horizontal scrolling

steps.action: Scroll vertically through the weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: Scrolling is smooth and all days of the week with their respective shifts are accessible. Headers remain visible or appropriately positioned

steps.action: Verify all shift details are clearly visible for each day
steps.expectedResult: For each scheduled shift, start time, end time, location, and role are displayed clearly and are easily readable on the mobile screen. Information is not truncated or overlapping

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my monthly schedule to plan long-term commitments

testCases.title: Validate monthly schedule display
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has scheduled shifts for the current month and next month
Employee is logged out initially
Application is accessible and running
Test data includes at least 3 shifts in current month with complete details

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Monthly View' option in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Current month's schedule is displayed in calendar grid format showing all days of the month with scheduled shifts highlighted

steps.action: Verify that all scheduled shifts for the current month are visible on the calendar
steps.expectedResult: All shifts are displayed on their respective dates with basic information (time, shift type) visible on the calendar grid

steps.action: Click on a date that has a scheduled shift
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed in a popup or side panel showing complete information including shift time, duration, location, and any additional notes

steps.action: Close the shift details popup/panel by clicking the close button or clicking outside the panel
steps.expectedResult: Popup/panel closes and monthly calendar view remains displayed

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Month' navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: Calendar transitions to display the next month's schedule without errors, showing the correct month name and year in the header

steps.action: Verify that shifts scheduled for the next month are displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the next month are visible on their respective dates with accurate information

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Monthly view displays the next month's schedule
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access control for monthly schedules
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged in to the application
Employee B has scheduled shifts in the current month
Access control and authorization mechanisms are configured
Employee A knows Employee B's employee ID

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, navigate to the monthly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's monthly schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Attempt to modify the URL or use API endpoint to access Employee B's monthly schedule by changing the employeeId parameter (e.g., /api/schedules/monthly?employeeId={EmployeeB_ID}&month={current_month})
steps.expectedResult: Access denied error message is displayed indicating 'You do not have permission to view this schedule' or similar authorization error

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for Employee B is visible or accessible
steps.expectedResult: No shift information for Employee B is displayed, and the calendar remains empty or shows an error message

steps.action: Check that Employee A is redirected back to their own schedule or an error page
steps.expectedResult: System either redirects to Employee A's schedule or displays an appropriate error page with HTTP 403 Forbidden status

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's schedule data remains secure and inaccessible to Employee A
Security event is logged in the system audit trail
No unauthorized data exposure occurred

testCases.title: Test responsiveness of monthly view on mobile
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has scheduled shifts for the current month
Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available for testing
Mobile device has internet connectivity
Application is mobile-responsive and accessible via mobile browser
Screen resolution is set to typical mobile dimensions (e.g., 375x667 for iPhone, 360x640 for Android)

steps.action: Open the application URL in a mobile device browser (Chrome, Safari, or Firefox)
steps.expectedResult: Application login page loads and displays correctly on mobile screen without horizontal scrolling

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials using the mobile keyboard and tap 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the mobile-optimized dashboard

steps.action: Tap on 'Monthly View' option in the navigation menu (may be in a hamburger menu)
steps.expectedResult: Monthly calendar view loads and displays in a mobile-optimized layout with calendar grid adjusted for smaller screen

steps.action: Verify that the calendar grid is readable with dates and shift information visible without zooming
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays with appropriately sized text and touch-friendly elements, all content is legible, and no text or elements are cut off

steps.action: Tap on a date with a scheduled shift
steps.expectedResult: Shift details appear in a mobile-optimized popup or panel that fits the screen, with all information readable and properly formatted

steps.action: Scroll through the shift details if necessary
steps.expectedResult: Content scrolls smoothly within the popup/panel without affecting the background calendar

steps.action: Close the shift details by tapping the close button or tapping outside the panel
steps.expectedResult: Popup/panel closes smoothly and calendar view remains displayed

steps.action: Use swipe gesture or tap navigation arrows to move to the next month
steps.expectedResult: Calendar transitions smoothly to next month with responsive layout maintained

steps.action: Rotate the mobile device to landscape orientation
steps.expectedResult: Calendar layout adjusts automatically to landscape mode, maintaining readability and usability

steps.action: Rotate back to portrait orientation
steps.expectedResult: Calendar layout adjusts back to portrait mode without errors or layout issues

postconditions: Employee remains logged in on mobile device
Monthly view maintains responsive layout in both orientations
All interactive elements remain functional and touch-friendly
No layout breaks or rendering issues are present

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to navigate between different schedule views to choose the most useful format

testCases.title: Validate switching between schedule views
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has scheduled shifts for current day, current week, and current month
Employee is logged in to the application
All three view types (daily, weekly, monthly) are implemented and accessible
A specific date (e.g., 15th of current month) is selected for context preservation testing

steps.action: From the dashboard, navigate to the schedule section and select 'Daily View' option
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule is displayed showing shifts for the current day in a detailed list or timeline format with all shift information visible

steps.action: Verify that the current date is highlighted and displayed in the view header
steps.expectedResult: Current date is clearly indicated with proper formatting (e.g., 'Monday, January 15, 2024') and any shifts for today are listed

steps.action: Navigate to a specific date (e.g., 15th of the month) using date picker or navigation controls in daily view
steps.expectedResult: Daily view updates to show the selected date (15th) with corresponding shifts displayed

steps.action: Click on 'Weekly View' button or tab in the view switcher controls
steps.expectedResult: View transitions smoothly to weekly schedule without full page reload, displaying the week containing the 15th (previously selected date) with all days of that week visible in a grid or column format

steps.action: Verify that the date context (15th) is preserved and highlighted in the weekly view
steps.expectedResult: The 15th is highlighted or marked as the selected date within the weekly calendar, and the week containing this date is displayed

steps.action: Verify that the transition occurred without full page reload by checking that the page header and navigation remain unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Only the schedule content area updates; no browser refresh occurs, URL may update but page doesn't reload, transition time is under 1 second

steps.action: Review the weekly schedule to ensure all shifts for the week are displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the entire week are visible with appropriate details, organized by day in a clear layout

steps.action: Click on 'Monthly View' button or tab in the view switcher controls
steps.expectedResult: View transitions smoothly to monthly schedule without full page reload, displaying the month containing the 15th (previously selected date) in a calendar grid format

steps.action: Verify that the date context (15th) is preserved and highlighted in the monthly view
steps.expectedResult: The 15th is highlighted or marked as the selected date within the monthly calendar, and all shifts for the month are displayed on their respective dates

steps.action: Verify that the transition occurred without full page reload
steps.expectedResult: Only the schedule content area updates; no browser refresh occurs, transition is smooth and completes in under 1 second

steps.action: Switch back to daily view by clicking the 'Daily View' button
steps.expectedResult: View transitions back to daily schedule showing the 15th (preserved date context) without page reload

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Selected date context (15th) is preserved across all view switches
Daily view is currently displayed showing the 15th
No errors are present in browser console
All view transitions completed in under 1 second each

testCases.title: Verify access control consistency across views
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged in to the application
Employee B has scheduled shifts in daily, weekly, and monthly views
Access control is configured to restrict employees to their own schedules
Employee A knows Employee B's employee ID

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, navigate to the daily schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's daily schedule is displayed correctly with their own shifts

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's daily schedule by modifying the URL or API endpoint to include Employee B's ID (e.g., /api/schedules/daily?employeeId={EmployeeB_ID})
steps.expectedResult: Access denied error is displayed with message such as 'Unauthorized access' or 'You do not have permission to view this schedule', and no schedule data for Employee B is shown

steps.action: Navigate to the weekly schedule view using the view switcher
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's weekly schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's weekly schedule by modifying the URL or API endpoint to include Employee B's ID (e.g., /api/schedules/weekly?employeeId={EmployeeB_ID})
steps.expectedResult: Access denied error is displayed consistently with the same error message format as in daily view, and no schedule data for Employee B is shown

steps.action: Navigate to the monthly schedule view using the view switcher
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's monthly schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's monthly schedule by modifying the URL or API endpoint to include Employee B's ID (e.g., /api/schedules/monthly?employeeId={EmployeeB_ID})
steps.expectedResult: Access denied error is displayed consistently with the same error message format as in previous views, and no schedule data for Employee B is shown

steps.action: Verify that in all three views, the error handling is consistent and appropriate
steps.expectedResult: All three views display the same type of access denied error with consistent messaging, HTTP 403 status code, and no data leakage

steps.action: Verify that Employee A is automatically redirected back to their own schedule or an error page in each view
steps.expectedResult: System handles unauthorized access consistently across all views by either redirecting to Employee A's schedule or displaying a proper error page

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedules
Employee B's schedule data remains secure across all views
Security events are logged in the system audit trail for all three unauthorized access attempts
Access control is confirmed to be consistent across daily, weekly, and monthly views
No unauthorized data exposure occurred in any view

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive clear error messages when schedule data is unavailable to understand system status

testCases.title: Validate error message on data unavailability
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has permission to access schedule page
Test environment is configured to simulate API failures
Network connectivity is available between client and server

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page URL
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page begins loading

steps.action: Simulate schedule data API failure by disabling the schedule API endpoint or configuring mock failure response
steps.expectedResult: API returns error status code (500, 503, or similar)

steps.action: Observe the schedule page display after API failure
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error message is displayed on the page instead of schedule data. Message should be clear, non-technical, and explain that schedule data is currently unavailable

steps.action: Review the error message content for clarity and helpfulness
steps.expectedResult: Error message uses plain language (e.g., 'We're sorry, schedule information is temporarily unavailable') and provides guidance on next steps

steps.action: Verify error message includes contact information for assistance
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is visible and clear, including support phone number, email address, or help desk link

steps.action: Check that the contact information is clickable/actionable (if email or phone)
steps.expectedResult: Email links open default mail client and phone numbers are formatted as clickable links on mobile devices

steps.action: Verify error is logged in the system error logs
steps.expectedResult: Error entry appears in application logs with timestamp, error type, and relevant details for support team

postconditions: Error message remains displayed until API is restored or page is refreshed
Error is logged in monitoring system for support team review
Employee has clear path to get assistance
No application crash or unhandled exceptions occur

testCases.title: Verify no sensitive info in error messages
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Test environment is configured to trigger API errors with backend details
Access to backend logs to verify actual error details
Security testing tools or configuration available to simulate detailed error responses

steps.action: Configure the schedule API to return an error response that includes sensitive system details (e.g., database connection strings, internal server paths, stack traces, API keys)
steps.expectedResult: Backend API error contains sensitive technical information

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page as an employee user
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page attempts to load and encounters the configured API error

steps.action: Observe the error message displayed to the employee on the frontend
steps.expectedResult: Error message shown to user is generic and safe, containing no technical details, database information, server paths, or stack traces

steps.action: Inspect the browser console for any exposed sensitive information
steps.expectedResult: Console logs do not contain sensitive system details visible to end users

steps.action: Check the network response in browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: API response to client contains sanitized error message without exposing internal system architecture or credentials

steps.action: Verify that detailed error information is logged server-side only
steps.expectedResult: Backend logs contain full error details including stack trace and system information for debugging purposes

steps.action: Confirm the user-facing error message provides appropriate level of information
steps.expectedResult: Message is helpful but generic (e.g., 'An error occurred while retrieving your schedule. Please try again later or contact support.') without revealing system vulnerabilities

postconditions: No sensitive information is exposed to the employee user interface
Detailed error information is securely logged for authorized support personnel only
Application security posture is maintained
User receives actionable guidance without technical details
